Name: 3_genocide_group_of genocide_genocide is
Representative_Docs: ['srebrenica had systematic calculated close range genocidal executions of people the bulk of the town s adult male muslim population of the kind you saw the palestinians carry out on oct th and the idf hasn t carried out at any point since and yes those are the reason it s genocide and not any other transfer in the yugoslav wars the transfers alone were at most further evidence of the intent behind the executions not sufficient for genocide as the same icty pointed out in the staki case it does not suffice to deport a group or a part of a group a clear distinction must be drawn between physical destruction and mere dissolution of a group the expulsion of a group or part of a group does not in itself suffice for genocide as kre has stated t his is true even if the expulsion can be characterised as a tendency to the dissolution of the group taking the form of its fragmentation or assimilation this is because the dissolution of the group is not to be equated with physical destruction in this context the chamber recalls that a proposal by syria in the sixth committee to include i mposing measures intended to oblige members of a group to abandon their homes in order to escape the threat of subsequent ill treatment as a separate sub paragraph of article ii of the convention against genocide was rejected by twenty nine votes to five with eight abstentions if you believe it s a myth that genocides always include close range executions death camps and the like name one universally recognized genocide that didn t include close range executions at the very least i get that there are academics who decided that the us carried out genocide against the germans and the japanese in ww against the north koreans in the korean war the vietnamese in the vietnam war and so on but the genocides that we all can agree are genocides be it the armenian genocide the holocaust srebrenica darfur rwanda the isis genocide of the yazidis all included mass close range executions and if you want to limit it to the law it s even more limited the only two genocides that were judged by international tribunals included those close range systematic executions and not even all close range executions mind you sure the genocide convention could be theoretically more broad but the way the icty and ictr and specifically icj interpreted it was very clearly not and if you want to talk about evidentiary standards the bar for inferring genocidal intent from pattern of behavior that requires genocidal intent to be the sole reasonable inference more or less demands something of that sort the icj in the south african case found at most that there s a plausible future risk of genocide for the palestinians not that israeli officials statements actually prove that any idf action was done with genocidal intent preventing return after displacement makes it illegal forcible transfer of population not ethnic cleansing a term that has no clear definition unless it s done for a legal reason like legitimate and proportional security needs yes i don t think i said otherwise urban warfare by its nature essentially always includes systemic and predictable civilian harm systemic and predictable civilian harm is not by itself even illegal as long as proportionality and distinction are observed let alone inherently genocidal and many if not all wars include dehumanizing language from at least some of the participants to some extent or another if only by the actual soldiers on the ground and often well beyond that and while not every war includes everything you said there were absolutely wars that included more destruction expulsion of far more people far more brutal sieges etc and are not considered genocide the only thing you could argue here is that gaza is a tiny area so if we pretend it s its own country not even part of palestine the destruction is very large as a percentage of that country but if that s the argument then the thing lead to that destruction and expulsions the scope of civilian enmeshment the massive war machine built exclusively under and inside people s homes mosques hospitals and schools militarizing the overwhelming majority of the built up area in the strip is not just the biggest in history it s several orders of magnitude worse than any other examples incidentally the human animals is part of the lies that south africa has been telling you to the point i even wrote a post about it at the time you re not making a good point when you quote that part or other parts of the ludicrous sa arguments like amalek and so on isn t making your case stronger it shows you re relying on bad information', 'here s the us holocaust memorial museums definition genocide is an internationally recognized crime where acts are committed with the intent to destroy in whole or in part a national ethnic racial or religious group these acts fall into five categories killing members of the group causing serious bodily or mental harm to members of the group deliberately inflicting on the group conditions of life calculated to bring about its physical destruction in whole or in part imposing measures intended to prevent births within the group forcibly transferring children of the group to another group there are a number of other serious violent crimes that do not fall under the specific definition of genocide they include crimes against humanity war crimes ethnic cleansing and mass killing', 'in the present convention convention on the prevention and punishment of the crime of genocide article ii genocide means any of the following acts committed with intent to destroy in whole or in part a national ethnical racial or religious group as such killing members of the group causing serious bodily or mental harm to members of the group deliberately inflicting on the group conditions of life calculated to bring about its physical destruction in whole or in part imposing measures intended to prevent births within the group forcibly transferring children of the group to another group x b so basically we have a genocide on both sides']

access to for the most part all the money given to israel is spent on us produced military hardware the us funding accounts for about of israeli military spending and or more of the us funding is on us products just as a quick overview israel and the us is working jointly to develop other systems of interception such as high power modern laser interdiction systems which may actually allow the israelis in the future to actually ignore attempted rocket salvos since the low cost of laser interdiction may end up with a cost analysis where the destruction of incoming munitions costs the rocket producers more than the defense compared to the current arrangement which is about times more costly for israel which is one of many reasons the us provides funding to the israelis it s literally a program of funding the continued military superiority of israel which the us does to make it possible for israel to avoid feeling the need to make use of temporary military supremacy in order to end the war with neighboring enemies before that temporary edge is lost to unforeseen future circumstances it s quite literally the us paying the israelis to chill this started during the cold war when one of the highest tension moments between the us and the ussr was during the yom kippur war the israeli willingness to work with us conflict de escalation attempts and their economic suffering following the opec oil embargoes placed the us in a position where they increasingly valued israel and felt responsible for israel s role on the frontlines against soviet expansion in the region']

Name: 9_genocide_intent_of genocide_is
Representative_Docs: ['does israel have a plan of complete extermination like the nazis did i don t think so you seem to believe that a genocide can only fit this description but in fact the legal definition is far broader than that no it s not far broader than that the legal definition requires a specific intent to biologically destroy a protected group in whole or in part so yes they do need to have a specific intent for complete extermination of the palestinians in gaza or a part that is substantial to their biological survival e g the entire male population if there s no intent to physically destroy a protected group there s simply no genocide beyond the legal considerations i used this term to qualify the very real destructive intent toward pakestinian identity and society the gov seeks to destroy all possibility of life in gaza to destroy institutions and the entire social fabric of course it wants to destroy institutions of an enemy that has a singular desire to eliminate them and a social fabric that s deeply embedded with said enemy the allies in ww destroyed german and japanese institutions entire social fabric in wars against their entire societies while killing hundreds of thousands of civilians and burning multiple cities to the ground they did not commit a genocide even the most gentle kinds of serious wars like the iraq war where the goal was not merely to not target the civilian population according to ihl rules but to make friends with them and be greeted as liberators by no means the default obvious or legally required case was still about destroying institutions and to some extent social fabric which was deeply embedded with baath arguing that destroying institutions makes a genocide doesn t just go beyond legal considerations it goes beyond any reasonable definition of genocide full stop as for destroying all possibility of life in gaza as i said the very existence of the ghf undermines this thesis not supports it but even if we just conclude that the goal here is to make gaza unlivable in order to expel the palestinians to somewhere else it means it s not genocidal intent the law is very clear on this the icty and icj ruled that actual close range massacres not merely bulldozing buildings are not genocide because they were aimed to expel rather than destroy to this day most israelis do not recognize the palestinian plight as a legitimate aspiration that s a pretty wild argument do you think any of israel s enemies throughout its entire history recognized the plight of the jewish people and their legitimate aspirations to a state or for that matter their even more legitimate aspiration to not have their existing state eliminated and its jewish population subjugated expelled or exterminated the actual palestinian aspiration and the root cause of the palestinian plight does that mean that every war israel has fought not just oct th and not just against the palestinians was actually a genocide against the israeli jews when snipers systematically shoot children in the head this goes beyond simple war crimes it s not clear it s even war crimes at all let alone it being systematic a word that doesn t just mean happened multiple times or even committed by idf soldiers to begin with but let s assume for a moment that the idf high command ordered snipers to shoot dozens of innocent palestinian children in the head that would be a war crime and a crime against humanity of murder it would not even be the crime of extermination let alone genocide genocide doesn t mean war crimes that are exceptionally cruel anymore than it means wars that disrupt institutions and social structures again if israel actually had genocidal intent it would not be risking its soldiers lives to snipe at a few dozen random palestinian children or to use live fire for crowd control it would be carrying out the kinds of mass close range executions we ve seen in all the actual genocides including oct th we would at least see the israelis actually doing what they were accused for months of doing and firebombing the mawasi refugee area or simply starving all the gazans to death israel had the means and the opportunity to destroy the gazans for over a year and a half the fact it didn t do it shows it simply doesn t have the intent', 'i m sorry to hear about the strain in your friendship especially over such a complex and emotionally charged issue like the israel palestine conflict the conversation you had with your friend about the use of the term genocide to describe israel s actions in palestine particularly in gaza is reflective of the deep divisions and strong emotions this topic evokes when it comes to the term genocide it s crucial to understand its definition and the context in which it s being applied the united nations genocide convention defines genocide as acts committed with the intent to destroy in whole or in part a national ethnical racial or religious group in the context of israel and palestine your friend s perspective seems to be that the actions of israel especially in gaza fit this definition this viewpoint is often grounded in the significant power imbalance between israel and palestine with israel possessing more military and economic power the impact of this imbalance is profoundly felt in gaza where israeli military operations have resulted in considerable civilian casualties and widespread destruction of infrastructure this severe impact on the civilian population coupled with policies that some argue aim to systematically undermine the palestinian presence and rights in the region can lead to the perception that these actions constitute an attempt to destroy at least in part the palestinian group furthermore the context of an asymmetrical conflict where one side has overwhelming military superiority is also a crucial aspect of this perspective the argument here is that the disproportionate impact on palestinian civilians the blockade of gaza and the ongoing occupation and settlement expansion in the west bank are indicative of a policy that goes beyond mere military objectives or self defense the high civilian death toll the destruction of homes and vital infrastructure and the long term psychological and physical impact on the palestinian population are seen as evidence supporting the claim of genocide on the other hand when considering hamas and its actions against israel it s important to differentiate between acts of violence or terrorism and genocide while hamas has indeed launched rocket attacks against israeli cities and espoused rhetoric that is hostile to israel these actions although part of a violent conflict are typically not regarded as genocide by most international experts and bodies this is primarily because the group lacks both the intent and the capability to physically destroy the israeli population in whole or in part which is a key component of the legal definition of genocide in your conversation when discussing whether hamas s actions could be considered genocide your friend pointed out that the scale of israeli casualties caused by hamas is too small and that hamas would never be successful in completely destroying israel this argument highlights the importance of intent and capability in the legal definition of genocide the intent to destroy a group as well as the capability to do so are both critical elements in constituting a genocide under international law it s clear that both you and your friend have strong differing views on this matter in such emotionally charged debates it s not uncommon for people to feel overwhelmed or to need space as your friend did the complexity of the israel palestine conflict often means that even well intentioned discussions can lead to misunderstandings or hurt feelings', 'the definition of genocide is the deliberate killing of a large number of people from a particular nation or ethnic group with the aim of destroying that nation or group there are many prominent figures repeating again and again that israel is committing genocide it s actually disgraceful it s an insult to the many genocides that have actually occurred in the last years that no one cares about or even knows of let me explain why the genocide claims are not true israel has no stated intention of committing genocide the genocidal statements of some israeli governments officials and representatives are not evidence of stated intention they re just a few peoples edgy opinions that are not carried out in a tangible way approximately palestinians have died since and most of the deaths have been during war periods this averages out to about per year for reference the nazis killed about million jews per year between and the palestinian population has gone up x since and the gazan population has doubled since israel have gaza back in if they were hell bent on genocide why would they do that israel supplies gaza with free water and electricity until recently a very strange thing to do if you are wanting to commit genocide israel provides palestinians with jobs and income another peculiar thing to do if one s intent is to commit genocide israel has tried to offer the palestinians their own state that they can have autonomy over a very very ridiculous thing to do if you wanted to eradicate a nation or group of people israel provides humanitarian aid to gazans furthermore israel built and funded a lot of the infrastructure in gaza in the s and s to prop it up and promote health services weird for a genocidal country to do that death toll genocide yes understanding plus gazans have died is not evidence of genocide you must understand why and how they have died did america commit genocide against the japanese iraqis afghans and germans did england commit genocide against the germans turks and italians no of course not they were fighting and the unfortunate result was loss of civilians life that is not evidence of genocide yes i m sure you can point to a few people in the israeli government who have said some not so smart things about solving the palestine issue and you can also point to bad apples in the idf who have acted out of line and been disciplined for it however this is not evidence of genocide you actually have to commit genocide to be accused of genocide i m also referring to raz segal owen jones and norman finkelstein their claims are ridiculous especially coming from university professors and i urge them to look at the many other genocides that have actually occurred and study those to understand what an actual genocide looks like']

Name: 11_aid_food_gaza_starvation
Representative_Docs: ['ok i ll let the article speak for itself the flour and rice come from donations gathered by the un and international humanitarian groups who usually buy the food in the west bank jordan or abroad and transport it through israel to gaza according to humanitarian sources the idf does not allow the supplies to be properly secured before trucks leave kerem shalom to enter the areas where starving gazans live sources in gaza report that idf soldiers rush aid workers to load cargo quickly then trucks are often delayed for hours and forced to take dangerous routes because the food isn t securely tied down it s easy to steal and most of the aid entering gaza is looted on the way some food also spills due to severe road damage for months the un and humanitarian aid groups have pleaded with the idf to allow food to enter through other crossings to give them time to secure and protect shipments and to use safer routes to ensure aid reaches those in need their requests have been repeatedly denied this is just one of many obstacles that israel places in the way of feeding gaza s residents and stopping the hunger crisis on the surface there is a puzzling gap between israel s repeated claims of increasing food supplies to gaza and the ongoing daily reports of deaths from starvation and severe malnutrition especially among children obstacles imposed by israel diaspora affairs minister amichai chikli has blocked dozens of organizations attempting to deliver aid police have failed to provide the necessary escort for trucks crossing from the jordanian border the idf delays trucks at the kerem shalom crossing and limits loading times which impacts drivers ability to secure the cargo the kerem shalom crossing is closed on fridays and saturdays aid workers and international volunteers are not permitted to enter gaza through kerem shalom at the same time as the trucks the idf has established checkpoints within gaza that impede the movement of trucks gaza s social order is rapidly deteriorating because many police officers have been targeted by the idf unrwa s activities are being disrupted restrictions persist on the entry of certain medical supplies and foods the reason is that humanitarian organizations and un agencies including the world food program unicef the world health organization and dozens more have been unable to rebuild the food distribution network that operated in gaza before the current crisis began on march at that time israel closed the border crossings for days entirely causing the network to collapse', 'on the common argument that israel is using starvation as a means of committing genocide while there have been periods where israel has restricted the amount of aid entering gaza they have still facilitated over million tons of aid since the start of the war the reason aid flows have varied significantly is due to israel being influenced by ceasefire negotiations various military operations shifting border policies and logistical constraints currently the only part of gaza where famine has been declared is in gaza city a km stretch of land note that the gaza strip is km in its entirety in northern gaza that is outside of the designated humanitarian zones where it remains a major combat zone due to hamas still retaining control over significant areas especially civilian populated neighborhoods israel has just launched operation gideon s chariots ii four days ago to advance into this area a famine is classified using the integrated food security phase classification ipc when at least of households face extreme food insecurity acute malnutrition in children exceeds and the death rate surpasses two people per per day due to starvation or related causes with gaza s population of over million this would mean at least dead each day for it to be classed as a famine in the whole strip in almost years of fighting the estimated number of dead due to starvation is currently just over half the number required per day to declare a famine for a famine to be declared by the ipc in gaza city independent media investigations show that the ipc lowered the malnutrition threshold from to and shifted its measurement method from the standard weight and height indicators to the less precise mid upper arm circumference muac metric as mentioned in the footnotes of the report they also withdrew the death toll requirement mentioned above the reason this was done was due to an assumption that the number of those dead from starvation is vastly higher than reported however recent scientific studies done on this that take into account non violent deaths alongside the gaza ministry of health s reliability while using the same capture recapture method used by others such as in the often quoted lancet study do not reflect this as the vast majority of estimated deaths as of june according to the publication referenced prior are from violence as opposed to starvation dehydration or disease so just to summarise israel has in fact facilitated large amounts of aid into gaza where israel retains some level of control famine has not been declared famine has only been declared in a localised area where israel lacks control and where hamas still retains de facto governance and control the ipc changed the metrics in order to declare famine in this localised area this declaration is now being used to claim that there is famine in gaza to apply political pressure on israel while playing into the narrative that all of gaza is starving by means of misleading language therefore the presence of famine can be explained as a distribution problem due to hamas s continued actions and refusal to surrender whereby they are intentionally misappropriating humanitarian aid while allowing the people who they still hold control over to starve in order to apply political pressure aka lawfare on israel meanwhile international organisations such as the ipc have been influenced by politicisation through which they have applied an eased methodology with little transparency of doing so edit comments and days later yet not a single person has challenged anything i wrote just insults being thrown with practically every rule broken multiple times let me make some things clear to those who think i am justifying or denying that there is starvation nothing in my post suggests this to those who think i am in approval of israel s conduct nothing in my post suggests this to those who think that i am saying that the amount of aid entering gaza is sufficient nothing in my post suggests this my post is about the declaration of famine and genocide nothing else never believe that anti semites are completely unaware of the absurdity of their replies they know that their remarks are frivolous open to challenge but they are amusing themselves for it is their adversary who is obliged to use words responsibly since he believes in words the anti semites have the right to play they even like to play with discourse for by giving ridiculous reasons they discredit the seriousness of their interlocutors they delight in acting in bad faith since they seek not to persuade by sound argument but to intimidate and disconcert if you press them too closely they will abruptly fall silent loftily indicating by some phrase that the time for argument is past jean paul sartre if anyone would like to debate me specifically about whether israel s overall intent is genocide feel free to check out my other post i am always up for a discussion or debate', 'your post is dripping with sarcasm and outrage at this moment there are current global conflicts with more casualties and more displaced than the israel gaza war but fine you ve chosen this one as your hill to die on so the problem is that hamas has stolen the food and aid that has gone in to gaza previously stolen from the civilian population stolen food and medicine from starving children that need it this has made it challenging to get food to the people that need it you may or may not know that the palestinian peace advocate ahmed fouad alkhatib recommended parachuting aid in because it was harder to intercept which israel and other countries were doing i don t blame you for being concerned when i googled whether people were starving here were the headlines nbc starvation looms as israel s total blockade on gaza enters its third month starvation is not happening but it looms al jaz updates israel kills world complicit in starvation of gaza children note no mention if the were all hamas part hamas and the implicit call for nations to do something and of course the mention of children again current conflicts in the world in similar or worse situation un news gaza worst case scenario unfolds as brutal aid blockade threatens mass starvation note it is not here yet but threatening un news gazans face hunger crisis as aid blockade nears two months bbc news gaza mass starvation warning the strangest thing is that israel is expected to deliver food to its enemy as if england delivered food to the germans in ww in any event there is a story days ago about idf planning major shift in gaza aid delivery in bid to thwart hamas diversion the plan is that international organizations and private security contractors will hand out boxes of food to individual gazan families the whole sale distribution of food wasn t working because it was all being stolen by the criminally unethical hamas and its palestinian supporters in the new plan each family will have a designated representative tasked with reaching a security zone in southern gaza where aid will be distributed each box will have enough food to last several days then the family representatives return to the security zone to receive the next parcel israel believes this method will make it harder for hamas to divert aid to its fighters interestingly now qatar and egypt are supporting an initiative calling for days of calm that would see the release of the remaining israeli captives in exchange for allowing food and shelter i m hopeful and i hope you are as well that hamas will accept this qatar egypt plan they have been prolonging a lot of suffering so people like you can blame israel for all of it according to the deal they would have to release the hostages which would mark a turning point and probably the beginning of the end of the war']

greatest journalist on this earth one who exposed the lies of the israeli occupation with his camera and fearless truth telling he knew well he was risking betrayal and death at the hands of a colleagues right outside while bravely documenting the horrors and crimes of the idf innocents destruction forces and unlike before when the cowardly occupation claimed their attacks were accidental this time they openly admitted to killing him on purpose they re even celebrating silencing gaza s most courageous voice a man i would dare say was the bravest journalist on the planet despite hunger injuries bombings and fires he was always the first to rush into the heart of the story camera in hand bringing the world the truth that otherwise would have been buried today he died burned and badly wounded alongside his fellow journalists and it s worth noting he wasn t carrying even a swiss army knife to harm anyone but he had a far greater weapon his heart and his camera lens and this weapon terrifies the terrorist occupation they accused him of serving hamas just to cover their cruelty wickedness failure moral and religious decay shamelessness lies and vile arrogance and utter barbarity trash talking someone you just killed who can t even defend themselves anymore is beyond disgusting but honestly i didn t expect anything different that s why they violently and brutally assassinated him i will share the link to the footage for anyone whose heart can bear to see this this was the last will of the martyr anas al sharif this is my will my final message if my words reach you know that israel has succeeded in killing me and silencing my voice peace and god s mercy be upon you all god knows i gave every ounce of my strength and effort to be a support and voice for my people since i first opened my eyes in the alleys of jabalia refugee camp i dreamed of living long enough to return with my family to our original home ashkelon al majdal now occupied but god s will was stronger i have lived pain in every detail tasted loss again and again yet never once did i hold back from telling the truth pure and unedited may god be witness against those who stay silent those who accept our killing those who trap our breaths and whose hearts remain untouched by the broken bodies of our children and women they have not stopped this massacre that has gone on for over a year and a half i entrust you with palestine the jewel of muslims and the heartbeat of every free soul on earth i entrust you with its people its innocent children who never had a chance to dream or live in peace their pure bodies were crushed under thousands of tons of israeli bombs and missiles torn apart and scattered on the walls i urge you not to let chains silence you not to let borders hold you back be bridges to liberate this land and its people until the sun of dignity and freedom rises on our stolen homeland i entrust you with my family with my beloved daughter sham whom i never got to watch grow as i had hoped i entrust you with my dear son salah whom i wished to guide and support until he could carry the burden and continue this mission i entrust you with my mother whose prayers were my shield and whose light guided me may god comfort her and reward her greatly and i entrust you with my life partner my wife umm salah bayan who endured long months and days of separation caused by war yet remained steadfast like an olive tree that never bends strong patient and faithful she carried the burden in my absence with faith and courage i ask you to stand by them to be their support after god if i die know that i die steadfast in my beliefs content with god s judgment believing in our meeting again and certain that what god has prepared is better and eternal o god accept me among the martyrs forgive all my past and future sins make my blood a light that illuminates the path to freedom for my people and family forgive me if i fell short pray for my mercy i stayed true to my promise never changing or turning away do not forget gaza and do not forget me in your prayers for forgiveness and acceptance anas jamal al sharif anas al sharif mohammed qreiqeh ibrahim zaher mohammed nafel and moamen aliwa dear five journalists we will never forget you']

Name: 15_zionist_zionists_anti_zionism
Representative_Docs: ['i watched a minute anti zionist lecture and came out more zionist just watched a minute lecture by anti zionist rabbi yaakov shapiro and i actually learned a lot no sorry pro palestine i didn t come out of it less of a zionist but i do understand better how people arrive at anti zionism while telling themselves it has nothing to do with antisemitism shapiro s main claim is this judaism is only a religion nothing more according to him jews aren t a people or a nation just individuals obligated to mitzvot in his view once we stop fulfilling those commandments our identity disappears israel therefore isn t a continuation of jewish tradition it s a replacement for it a national identity invented to secularize and normalize the jew that s his argument and i kind of agreed with some of it he cited quotes from early zionist thinkers some of which are downright horrifying calling diaspora jews parasites weaklings even shameful there s no denying that many of zionism s early architects were desperate to escape the stereotype of the ghetto jew and create a new jewish archetype muscular militant sovereign it wasn t pretty it was in part a reaction to centuries of humiliation but here s the contradiction that shapiro and anti zionists in general never quite resolve they reject jewish peoplehood but they exclusively speak about jews as a collective when it comes to criticizing israel they claim zionism is political not religious but then accuse israel of corrupting judaism they say israel doesn t represent the jewish people while simultaneously demanding that jews worldwide answer for israel s actions it s a dance of denial erasing peoplehood when it s inconvenient then weaponizing it when it s useful and it misses something deeper for the average zionist like me the belief isn t that jews deserve a state because we re better it s that every jewish story whether in morocco ukraine iraq germany or ethiopia ended the same way and then they turned on us zionism didn t erase judaism it gave it political teeth it said your torah doesn t need to be studied in exile forever your prayers don t have to rise up from someone else s basement you don t need to ask the pope or the czar or the king for permission to live yes some early zionists said awful things yes zionism was messy arrogant and sometimes wildly misguided but even in all their ideological chaos they built the one thing that every other jewish survival strategy failed to produce sovereignty we re not always at our best when we run the show we ve made mistakes but at least we have a show to run so no i m not disillusioned i m more resolved and i m grateful i watched the video it reminded me of something important zionism isn t perfect but it was never meant to be it was just meant to give jews one place on earth where our safety wasn t up for debate where our future wasn t outsourced where our story didn t have to end with and then they turned on us', 'people don t know what zionism means and it s ruining like of the discourse people don t know what zionism is and that s really scary and yes the meaning of this word is incredibly important i see a lot of people claiming to be antizionist while not being antisemitic and i don t think people understand what antizionism means at all the contemporary definition ever since the creation of israel in the preservation of the existence of the jewish state that s it if you think israel should be on a map and then you are a zionist the contemporary definition of anti zionism ever since the creation of israel in is the negation of the definition of zionism which would be the end of the existence of the jewish state if you think something should happen that dissolves the state of israel then you are an anti zionist that s the extent of the word zionism it has nothing to do with the settlements or with the executive office and yes i m aware that settlers are zionists but guess what the palestinian israeli citizens that had to flee hamas and were taken in and naturalized by israel are also zionists the druze and the christians the secular people and the muslims in israel all are zionists with the obvious exceptions of radical anarchist individuals in every society even the adl knows anti zionism has been bastardized into a antisemitic dogwhistle and is now being used by people who simply oppose netanyahu unaware of the word s definition if you ve wondered why you ve been called antisemitic for calling yourself antizionist thinking it means i oppose israel s military but i still think israel should exist then you are in fact a zionist which isnt a bad thing you ve just been gaslit or misinformed into thinking zionism jews when they re bad this is the most important takeaway from from the adl anti zionism is distinct from criticism of the policies or actions of the government of israel or critiques of specific policies of the pre state zionist movement in that it attacks the foundational legitimacy of jewish statehood zionism pro settlements zionism pro netanyahu zionism pro jews anti zionism pro hamas anti zionism pro jewish diaspora anti zionism anti jew if anyone is wondering i am a progressive and i m making this post because i see so many misled progressives and leftists siding with hamas putting antizionist in their bios without understanding how horrible it is calling for federal aid to hamas tearing down hostage posters in the name of antizionism when these same people would ve killed to punch a nazi in the face just a couple years ago we need to do better edit means does not equal', 'i m sorry but if you re not even aware that liberal zionists exist of the likes of meretz ratz mapam the liberal wing of labor beilin sarid or s yizhar then you re not qualified to talk about this issue it s not some theoretical philosophical issue that you get to deduce from first principles it s an actual part of the zionist movement that constantly criticizes israel opposes israeli military actions opposes the settlements opposes the occupation supports liberal values and equality within israel and so on and so on and no they don t accept being anti zionists they d be appalled if you told them they re merely the moderate wing of anti zionism as opposed to the more extreme wing along with hamas khamenei or assad or more precisely think you re a right wing blowhard the equivalent of american who thinks that anyone who opposed trump is on the same spectrum of anti americanness as bin laden iran and north korea as for the icj and the un a few problems with your arguments neither of them identify as anti zionist organizations the icj s decision has nothing to do with anti zionism if anything it was a liberal zionist decision strongly based on the two state formula that the jewish community in the area of the british mandate of palestine has the right of self determination and that israel is a legitimate state with legitimate borders it s just that those borders don t pass on along the separation barrier something israel doesn t even officially disagree with the un was only openly anti zionist between and and yes the arab countries who authored resolution openly believed israel should be destroyed some of them actively pursued that goal militarily their supporters in the communist and rd world bloc weren t all actively pursuing it but wanted to please the anti zionist arab states and wouldn t mind if they achieved their anti zionist goal of eliminating israel and notably resolution is one of the few resolutions actually repealed the un hasn t been an openly anti zionist organization for the past thirty years no the un s political whims don t determine what zionism and anti zionism are no idea what gave you that idea as for every person on earth being anti zionist by nature because international law rejects the current essence of israel it s absolute nonsense from the standpoint of international law saying israel shouldn t build settlements or the infrastructure to support them isn t rejecting the current essence of israel the vast majority of people on earth don t care or even know about international law many actively oppose it few think it s something that should define their opinions i have no idea why you decided that every baby born in the world is automatically endowed with the same views as your leftist group of friends i thought we re pretending that anti zionism isn t about rejecting the essence of israel i e a jewish state in the land of israel but rather its policies']

Name: 49_apartheid_south_africa_south africa
Representative_Docs: ['peace and apartheid', 'i can t tell whether you misrepresented article ii out of deliberate dishonesty or simple ignorance but it s unfortunate that you feel the need to resort to such tactics this doesn t come across as a good faith discussion from the un article defines the crime of apartheid which shall include similar policies and practices of racial segregation and discrimination as practised in southern africa you stopped mid sentence either you did not understand the text or you chose to cut the clause that decides the issue that is not honest argument here is the line you clipped with the part you left out in bold for the purpose of the present convention the term the crime of apartheid which shall include similar policies and practices of racial segregation and discrimination as practised in southern africa shall apply to the following inhuman acts committed for the purpose of establishing and maintaining domination by one racial group of persons over any other racial group of persons and systematically oppressing them that is the test a regime of domination the intent to keep it in place and the listed inhuman acts not annexation not citizenship conduct two items from article ii are directly on point and you left them out ii c exclusion from political social economic and cultural life including denial of the right to a nationality and the right to freedom of movement and residence ii d measures that divide the population into separate reserves and ghettos and expropriation of landed property south africa implemented policies against the south african people not an extraterritorial area if israel were to annex the west bank that would fit the un definition no annexation and citizenship do not appear in article ii international law attaches to effective control south africa already tried the move you are leaning on it carved out the bantustans stripped national citizenship and claimed the system was outside its responsibility the world rejected that legal fiction and the convention is written to pierce it if there is an institutionalized regime of domination an intent to maintain it and the listed acts the crime is made out whether the map lines were redrawn or not if you want the parallel criminal law definition the rome statute states it plainly an institutionalized regime of systematic oppression and domination by one racial group over any other committed with the intention of maintaining that regime no annexation caveat there either and under icerd article racial includes national or ethnic origin the citizenship wordplay does not change the analysis a quick legal point occupation law and the apartheid crime are different bodies of law one regulates the conduct of an occupier the other punishes a domination regime they can apply at the same time control without incorporation does not insulate a system that meets the elements of article ii the jim crow laws in america are most analogous jim crow is a history lesson not the standard the standard is elements do you have an institutionalized regime systematic domination and an intent to preserve it plus acts like political exclusion restrictions on movement and residence segregation into separate areas and expropriation of land if yes it fits that is what the text says when you quote all of it not just the half that helps you', 'that s a great question apartheid in it s original meaning explicitly referred to the legal racial segregation in south africa from to a system of discrimination and exploitation that unfairly penalized south africans on account of race it is similar to jim crow in that both refer to specific periods of legal racial discrimination within a single country nowadays people typically use the word to refer to the general practice of legal discrimination against a subset of people as you quoted perhaps those people don t need even to be citizens as you say but there does need to be a legal means by which the discrimination takes place occupation is a very different practice though there are a few similarities that stand out occupation refers to the military intervention a country exerts into a foreign territory not within its borders the actual length of time can very wildly from days to decades but a military occupation is always intended to be impermanent people living under a military occupation are still subject to the laws of their own territories the west bank has a palestinian authority that governs it s people they are not subject to the laws of the occupying power because they are not citizens the occupying power may exert influence over their lives and will likely treat them very differently than their own citizens but that is to be expected that treatment might resemble apartheid because it is discriminatory but it is extremely different at its core the difference ultimately comes down to israel s goals and strategy broadly speaking israel s justification for the extended military occupation is security given the history of conflict in the region it is an understandable stance if you believe that israel started every war it has ever been in maybe you would disagree but then we would have to back up and to agree on basic facts since the goal of the occupation is security israel maintains a military presence as long as there is credible chance of a threat occuring the implication is that israel would not need to continue the occupation if there was no genuine expectations of a security risk as it stands today that seems unlikely but israel doesn t want to be expending it s resources on military occupation it does so out of necessity for the protection of it s citizens for the system to be apartheid we are missing one crucial factor annexation if israel annexed the entire west bank and gaza and then continued to treat the palestinians living there as second class citizens they would do so through legal means codified discriminatory laws policies and practices and we could rightfully call them apartheid israel is in fact a state where laws exist and generally govern behavior the people living in israel are subject to these laws people living under israeli military occupation are not subject to israeli laws because they are not living in israel every country has the responsibility to protect it s citizens countries that fail to do so usually don t end up sticking around for a tiny country like israel it is especially vital that it figures out how to protect it s citizens effectively and sometimes that means taking drastic measures look at where israel is look at its history and try to approach it scientifically and with curiosity most of the surrounding and nearby countries do not want israel to exist as they have shown many times and with many wars israel has actively worked for decades to find peaceful solutions with its neighbors it has won land in defensive military operations and then given that land back as an attempt towards peace this is one of the reasons why egypt and israel have good relations now it has come to the table for peace talks negotiations many times and with sincere efforts only to be pushed back into a defensive position by wars and intifadas i don t know you and i won t assume your beliefs but if you believe this tiny country is truly as Name: 61_cleansing_ethnic_ethnic cleansing_ethnically
Representative_Docs: ['it s important to separate ethnic cleansing from the enforcement of law that results in forced removal and international law does this if individuals as individuals are being removed that s legal if whole population centers are being removed it is not so for example in a legal process people would be entitled to a trial with due process in an ethnic cleansing they just get shot or whatever what is being advocated for is in the other post and even in your comment is the latter ethnic cleansing specifically targets people because of their ethnicity or religion whereas enforcement actions target individuals based on legal status not identity completely false that sort of standard would allow any state to ethnically cleanse they just create a law which an entire population violates i want to clear x territory from group y i say make it illegal to live within miles of z river and enforce the law the key distinction is intent where the state acts against a legal violation not a group s inherent characteristics and the intent of the un is to maintain the racial purity of palestine large number of un members view jews as a racial pollution and thus believe palestine is legitimate in rejecting jewish emmigration no one objected to many instances of immigration that are similar for example russians in eastern europe certainly not decades later and applying to descendants the norm is precisely the opposite of what s going on with israel the deportation of illegal immigrants is generally not considered ethnic cleansing they are when they are done in mass and the communities they live in are destroyed upholding international law is crucial because it restores justice and establishes precedents that prevent future violations really gaza hamas are blatent violators of the international law around distinction can israel just absolve itself of all the actions since they upholding international law and restoring justice somehow when iran was violating the npt war wasn t justified you really want to open the door to the horrors you are advocating for upholding international law is crucial because it restores justice and establishes precedents that prevent future violations i m not ignoring it i think the removals have discriminatory intent and the whole settlement argument is a cover i also don t think non discriminatory intent grants one license to commit crimes against humanity which is where we disagree i advocate for the expulsion of the people living in illegal settlements purely due to such settlements being in violation of international law and do not support the killing or genocide of such people expulsion is killing you bomb rape burn down homes murder until they leave that s how it is done and before you go to the idf no the idf can t do the settlers rd of the officer core are settlers something like and likely an even higher percentage of idf deeply disagree with the un s position if the knesset ordered it which they won t do there would be a coup not a removal of the settlers they get removed they get removed by a foreign army which has to do it against idf opposition you are talking about the death of millions here in practice but in theory let s say just the death of say k to terrorize the other k into leaving', 'accusing israel of ethnic cleansing is quite ironic it s a spurious accusation and an absurd one no matter how common it is on the internet ironically israel is the only country in the region that did not systematically expel ethnic and religious minorities from its territory whether during war or in peacetime just in the levant in the th century alone the jews were originally ethnically cleansed from their ancient communities in both gaza and hebron in almost years before israel declared independence and almost years before the first settlement in the wb not to mention the ethnic cleaning of virtually all jews from syria lebanon and the kingdom of jordan in the middle of the th century according to red cross and unrwa records over jews were ethnically cleansed from their ancient communities in the wb including east jerusalem in when the arab legion invaded and jordan illegally occupied the territory for almost years even the jewish quarter of the old city of jerusalem was cleared of all jews and demolished in when it was captured by the arab legion and renamed arab east jerusalem that divided jerusalem until jordan forfeited its west bank in after losing another gratuitous war of conquest against israel on the other hand israel did not systematically expel arabs from its territory in fact the israeli declaration of independence specifically invites arabs within its sovereign borders to remain as israeli citizens and help to build the new country together many arabs did which is why over of israeli citizens are non jewish arabs with equal citizenship rights there were plenty of members of many arab ethnic groups and minority religions like the druze and beduins who fought alongside israel against the invading arab legion in and were proud to do so compare the multiculturalism and secularism of israel with the territories under the control of hamas and the pa that remain completely judenrein since at least it s quite a contrast the fact is that despite being the jewish state israel is the only secular country in the region where religious and ethnic minorities have equal citizenship rights and freedoms and where women and gays also have equal rights you will never see a gay pride parade in either gaza or ramallah for example almost of israeli citizens are muslim arabs and even more are christians druze beduins zoroastrians and bah s religions and ethnicities that face discrimination and oppression in the surrounding ethno centric arab and islamic countries but have found refuge in israel the bah faith s international headquarters for example known as the bah world centre is located in the northern city of haifa in israel unlike the situation in the territories under palestinian rule all israeli citizens both men and women have equal rights and freedoms regardless of religion ethnicity sexual orientation or national origin a situation not found in any of the other countries in the region arab muslims serve in the israeli parliament for example muslims serve as commanders in the idf there is even an arab muslim justice on israel s supreme court and he s not the first religious and ethnic minorities just do not have the same rights and freedoms in any of the other countries in the region like they have in israel the irony is that jews do not serve in the palestinian government or in the governments of any of the other countries of the muslim world precisely because they were gratuitously and systematically ethnically cleansed from their ancient communities in those countries in the middle of the last century almost a million jews were gratuitously expelled from their ancient communities in all the countries of the muslim world from morocco east through egypt and yemen north through syria and lebanon all the way through iraq and iran a century ago for example the population of baghdad was a third jewish they were jews living in their own ancient communities in iraq that predated the invention of islam and the arrival of the arabs by a thousand years ironically most israeli jews today are not ashkenazi jews from europe as many people on the internet seem to believe but are in fact the descendants of those refugees expelled from the arab and muslim world they re sephardic and mizrahi jews and babylonian jews expelled from iraq and persian jews from iran', 'on the topic of gradual genocide gaza s population has only gone up over the last years this fact alone challenges the idea that they have been experiencing a genocide over this timeframe to call this a genocide would go against the definition itself and would open the doors to the loss of meaning of the word genocide itself which would make future designation of the term in other conflicts more difficult this would have negative consequences on the implementation of international law and would reduce the validity of the term itself with regards to ethnic cleansing i can see that this is something the far right israeli government is pushing for however ethnic cleansing is not genocide i am absolutely against ethnic cleansing of course and i oppose this policy completely what muddies the water on this topic though is the definition of ethnic cleansing ethnic cleansing is the systematic forced removal of ethnic racial or religious groups from a given area with the intent of making the society ethnically homogeneous unlike the definition of genocide the term ethnic cleansing does not include national groups the palestinian identity at its core is a national identity not ethnic consider the fact that ethnically palestinians are the same as jordanians and israeli arabs after all they were part of the same country prior to i e the british mandate of palestine it is only in recent years that they have been considered a distinct group based on a shared nationalist cause please note that i am not trying to justify the removal of palestinians from gaza here i am only trying to use accurate terms which is what the whole aim of my post is in essence i would not say that genocide needs a new name but in this case i think the usage of the term ethnic cleansing needs a new name instead i am saying this from a scholarly perspective and i am not trying to make a moral or political commentary on the situation in gaza but rather i am calling into question the very language we use to accurately describe what is going on morally my stance on the situation in gaza is that people who want to leave should be able to and those who wish to stay should also be able to israel should not force either outcome on people in gaza and the gazan s should have the agency to decide on their fate israel should introduce more provisions to prevent forced expulsion such as resuming the flow of aid and the pursuit of a political resolution to the conflict such as the implementation of a new governing body in gaza with the help of the international community and local leaders who oppose hamas this is not something that can be achieved until hamas has been dismantled however']

Name: 82_victim_you_trauma_someone
Representative_Docs: ['no one s asking for your sympathy this isn t a pity contest victimhood might win headlines and weak make you look virtuous but it doesn t win wars if you can t protect your family you don t have the luxury of keeping one safe strength isn t something to apologize for power doesn t erase morality and it s not the same as cruelty if it were every cop would be a villain and that is real moralism because might defends the people close to you in the real world your moral standard seems to be weakness in exchange for sympathy what exactly are you suggesting that if you re not a loser you don t deserve to exist that s not morality that s naive and dangerously blind to how the world actually works', 'if someone tries to kill me i have the right to strike back in my own self defense against that person in a criminal trial i would not be excused for killing that person s whole family because that person tried to kill me vengeance killings in most democratic countries are illegal i do not have the right to kill that person s whole family or their cousins or religious leader just because that person tried to hurt me in no democracy that i know of does a person commit murder and the government is allow to punish whole families by making them homeless and demolishing their family s house that isn t okay', 'the only way to break a cycle of escalating violence is to stop escalating the violence even though the momentum of the cycle is pushing towards escalation and any specific escalation can be justified by its preceding event i am a therapist who has dedicated his career to working with trauma and i have seen these cycles of escalations writ small but still devastating in the lives of many individuals and families people who are hurt people who hurt others because they are hurting people who hurt others because they are afraid of being hurt themselves i hear the echos of pain and hurt throughout generations like ghosts that feed off of pain to grow stronger the first thing you learn in doing trauma work is that separating out victims and perpetrators is often a messy proposition and one that shifts depending on what time or what relationship you are focusing on in any given session people are often both sometimes even simultaneously if you go into trauma work looking to find heroes and villains you will find more than you ever thought possible and none at all the second thing you learn is that you cannot wait for the pain to lessen before the healing can begin the pain lessens because the healing begins the third thing you learn is that healing is not a passive experience it is often a courageous and defiant act against what the body and mind has learned is fundamentally necessary to keep themselves safe trauma tells truths about the dangers of the world but lies about the roads that travel from and through them it divides people relationships and experiences into rigid binaries of strength and weakness safety and vulnerability winners and losers fighters and victims trauma tells you that the only way to make it through the fire is to run faster fight harder and smash obstacles or set controlled burns ahead of you so the fire is always in your sight and never coming up from behind to heal means forgoing all that not listening to that damaged part of your psyche no matter how convinced it is that the fire is going to engulf you the moment you deviate from what it knows is the only way to keep you safe and fourth and perhaps most challenging at least for me lesson learned in trauma work is that true justice can be a lighthouse to steer one s ship but it isn t a destination many will ever reach that apology you hoped for may never be coming or may never fill the hole you hoped it would seeing your perpetrator suffer rarely makes your suffering feel any lighter hollywood endings are make believe but grace and forgiveness are real and accessible and their power towards healing often takes people by surprise so i will not answer your question as a diplomat or politician but i am not someone who hasn t sat at a table and helped negotiate functional treaties with trauma before it can be done in this case it would mean israel taking the bold and courageous step of choosing diplomacy and restraint over brute military force not because brute military force could not be justified but because it will ultimately further the cycle of trauma and escalation that is in no one s interest including israel s own israel could have seized the moment of initial international sympathy and shock to draw in closer to its western allies and the strained but with some recent progress towards normalizing relationships with the arab world itself and amplify international condemnation of hamas and unite pressure on and isolation of hamas amongst those who otherwise might have been less willing or engaged israel could have strengthened its relationship with fatah plo in the west bank through restarting meaningful negotiations there in return for real security guarantees and thereby showed the benefits of the alternative to the approach hamas took in gaza and israel could have negotiated prisoner exchanges for the hostages while also giving a clear deadline for further steps including militarily if the negotiations did not progress the negotiations would need time and undoubtedly gruelling patience and involvement from arab partners if they were to be fruitful but there may have been space for them to be successful under the right circumstances particularly if israel was able to use its restraint and its reopening of negotiations with fatah to build on its progress with normalizing its relationships in the arab world is this fair is this justice those are the wrong questions sadly if you are truly committed to healing and breaking free of the cycle of mutual destruction that is driving israelis and palestinians into the blood saturated ground a ground that doesn t care at all about fairness or justice as it swallows up generation and generation of people who were convinced that vengeance and might is the path to peace and security']

middle east eye icj genocide case israeli rhetoric against palestinians central to south africa s case ap news', 'the nakba narrative is exaggerated and misleading this is a long one between per israel and per arab sources of the arabs exited between december and this means the number ranges between to arabs there are two main phases of the israeli war of independence or as the palestinians refer to it as the nakba phase one november through to mid may of the decision to partition the land to an arab and jewish state is adopted by the un in november of accepted by the jews and rejected by the arabs in this phase the british mandate is still in effect there is no israeli army formally there is the paramilitary organization of hagana which at the time is mostly focused on defending jewish towns and neighborhoods from arab attacks during this time at least to arabs leave and they do so on their own accord the reasons for their leaving range from not wanting to be part of the new jewish state if they stay according the un partition map and some out of fear from the impending full scale war that neighboring arab states were threatening if the jewish state were to be created these people were not expelled by israel in any shape or form the second phase from mid may through to the armistice signed in in this phase some arabs were expelled by israel some escaped because of the fear of war and some were advised to leave by arab countries and return with the victorious arab armies so during this period another to exit it is virtually impossible to tell what percent of these people left solely because they were expelled by the israeli army all evidence is that there was no formal policy of expulsion so even if were expelled by israel that would mean to people the claim one can make is that after the war ended they were not allowed back in but in all fairness their condition to coming back was the dismantling for the jewish state and also the jews that were expelled from arab countries were not let back in either the arab exodus began voluntarily as early as december when established arab families in haifa and jaffa realized that according to the un partition plan the cities they lived in were slated to fall under jewish control similarly wealthy arab residents from the western neighborhoods of jerusalem began to leave in historian benny morris s words the arab flight became a sort of contagious disease spreading from house to house neighbor to neighbor street to street neighborhood to neighborhood and later from village to village the upper and educated classes feared being killed or wounded and feared the anarchy that accompanied the gradual withdrawal of the british civil and military administration most of the high class families who left haifa jerusalem jaffa acre and tiberias believed their exile would be temporary this phenomenon was described in the contemporary palestinian press as follows the first group of the fifth column traitors are those abandoning their homes and businesses and going to live elsewhere many of them lived in great comfort and luxury as soon as the first sign of trouble appeared they took off to avoid bearing the burden of the struggle directly or indirectly the neighboring countries did us a great disservice by accepting these who fled the battlefield they are the worst type of our fifth column traitors and deserve the harshest punishment from the palestinian newspaper al sha ab june according to morris following their departure the peasants and urban poor were also forced to leave having witnessed the mass flight of the wealthy which led to the closure of businesses schools law offices clinics and public services adding to this was the withdrawal of the british the departing people left due to fear of being left to face the zionist enemy alone despite the poverty and difficulty associated with leaving morris describes the first months of for the arabs of palestine as follows feelings of general collapse and disintegration in many places a small spark was enough to make the residents pack up and flee residents of arab cities fled and in doing so dragged along with them the rural population of the surrounding areas the causes for the departure of roughly a quarter million arabs in the first half of were largely internal arab causes lack of leadership economic hardship breakdown of law and order the voluntary departure in the early months of the war due to the absence of leadership and collapse of order can be seen in this report from a palestinian newspaper the residents of the large village of sheikh munis and many other arab villages in the tel aviv area have disgraced us all by abandoning their villages with their belongings and their children one cannot avoid comparing this shameful flight with the steadfast stance of the haganah in settlements located in arab regions but what use are comparisons for we all know that the haganah rushes into battle with courage while we flee from war from the palestinian newspaper al siraj march the voluntary departure in spring due to calls from arab leaders and institutions is reflected in this report from the economist correspondent in palestine in the days that followed the israeli authorities who now had full control of haifa called upon all arabs to remain and assured them that no harm would come to them to the best of my knowledge all british residents who were asked by their arab friends advised them to stay various factors influenced their decision to flee there is little doubt that the strongest factor was the broadcasts from the arab higher committee which called on all arabs to leave haifa it was made clear to them that once british forces completed their evacuation the armies of all the arab states would invade palestine and drive the jews into the sea it was also implied that any arabs who remained in haifa and accepted jewish protection would be considered traitors at that time the arabs of palestine still had some trust in the arab league s ability to deliver on its promises from the economist london october about two years later the editor of the lebanese newspaper al huda habib issa summarized the matter in hindsight in an editorial immediately after the british publicly announced their departure from the mandate in palestine the arab league began convening meetings and conferences its secretary general abdul rahman azzam pasha issued many declarations promising the arab nations that conquering palestine and tel aviv effectively the jewish capital would be as simple as a military parade azzam s statements noted that the armies were already at the borders and that the millions of pounds spent by the jews on land acquisition and economic development would surely fall into arab hands since it would be a simple matter to throw the jews into the mediterranean the arabs of palestine had no choice but to listen to the advice of the league and believe what azzam pasha and others told them that leaving their lands was only temporary and would end within days with the successful completion of the arab campaign of punishment against israel from the daily lebanese newspaper al huda june expulsion orders formal organized expulsion orders were issued to palestinian arabs during the war on two main occasions during the implementation of plan dalet when the haganah shifted from defense to offense and expelled arabs from key transport routes and border areas after the conquest of ramla and lydda there is no dispute that some of the refugees were expelled but the actual number is likely less than of those who actually left the new historians with the opening of israeli and british archives years after the war a new wave of research emerged led by the so called new historians these scholars argued that everything previously published about the war was largely zionist propaganda by official historians however even they had to acknowledge many arabs left without being expelled their criticism of israel was that israeli policy was to prevent their return even when they wanted to return their return was banned villages destroyed fields ruined or handed over to jewish settlements etc both the british national library and national library of israel have physical copies of the papers containing the quotes provided above but could not find downloadable pdf versions']

Name: 86_war crimes_crimes_war_war crime

Representative_Docs: ['not every war has war crimes the definition of war crime is clear war crimes defined by the un include targeting civilians torture inhumane treatment of prisoners deliberate attacks on humanitarian personnel or facilities and the use of certain prohibited weapons major war crimes include targeting civilian populations intentional attacks on schools hospitals and religious sites using forbidden weapons in civilian areas as i mentioned in the same thread below international law experts are labeling these atrocities by israel as war crimes based on international laws and conventions they re not terms people use to accuse eachother', 'i don t know if conjecture about who commits worse war crimes is super helpful war crimes are horrific always there is no moral high ground between two parties who both commit war crimes war crimes are unequivocally evil and any party who commits them has no right to pretend morality is a factor', 'war crimes are committed in every conflict often it s down to decisions of individual soldiers or commanders it doesn t mean the government or army top brass are telling the military to do them mostly it comes from lack of discipline war crimes are a legal term with two air strikes it s possible for one to be legal and kill people and one illegal that kills it s not a measure of violence even looting a shop is a war crime it also doesn t undermine the whole campaign necessarily coalition forces committed plenty of war crimes in afghanistan and even more recently fighting isis ukraine surely commits some war crimes too it doesn t really say much about thr belligerent on its own']

Name: 87_antisemitic_antisemitism_anti_criticism
