Name: 122_icj_the icj_the court_genocide
Representative_Docs: ['icj can t call it a genocide because such a stance would call their authority into question icj is a technical organization not motivated by fear from anyone it will look at the numbers on the ground and decide for sure lobbying will play a rule in the case but it will be limited if the icj calls it a genocide and then all the major world powers like the us and uk and germany simply ignore them us uk and germany will face an enormous pressure from its own citizens political parties and local ngo s if they ignore the icj rule they won t be able to handle that pressure and will have to give in to icj rule eventually these countries will also risk their global position and reputation in front of the world if they ignore icj ruling their reputation is already bad but it will get much worse the masses are already overwhelmingly pro palestine icj ruling that israel did a genocide will only validate their position fuel their effort this will further add pressure on the allies of israel', 'fascinating thought process i m just explaining the reality to you we all get things wrong myself included so there s nothing to get defensive about it s totally valid to conclude that equals indeed it s normal i feel i ve explained this for you several times one more go i m happy to help here s the wording from the rulings that is most relevant in light of the considerations set out above the court considers that there is urgency in the sense that there is a real and imminent risk that irreparable prejudice to the right to not be a victim of genocide will be caused to the rights found by the court to be plausible before it gives its final decision paragraph of the original january order and again in the updated order in light of the considerations set out above and taking account of the provisional measures indicated on january the court finds that the current situation before it entails a further risk of irreparable prejudice to the plausible rights claimed by south africa and that there is urgency in the sense that there exists a real and imminent risk that such prejudice to the right to not be a victim of genocide will be caused before the court gives its final decision in the case paragraph of march order it s not some abstract ruling it s based on evidence obviously it s an interim ruling hence why the word plausible is used israel may have a defence if the court didn t believe that israels actions were not plausibly causing genocide they would have thrown out the case it was in their power to do so the rights can only plausibly be at risk under the genocide convention if israel is plausibly committing a genocide that s the normal logic as already noted joan donoghue is a us judge previously worked at the us state department israels closest ally so the fact it s onlythe us judge and none of the other should speak volumes that line she said was simply a lie you don t need to believe a lie just because it suits your narrative always look to see how representative a single voice is and always check to see if it aligns with common sense indeed you ll struggle to find a decent legal expert saying anything different than i am there s a reason for that', 'correction on one point is that the icj has rejected sudans application for a trial of the uae in genocide of the sudanese people the issue is that international institution lacks any coercive power and direct territorial authority so their jurisdiction is limited to the extent that countries allow them to the court recalls that it has jurisdiction in respect of states only to the extent that they have consented thereto when a compromissory clause in a treaty provides for the court s jurisdiction that jurisdiction exists only in respect of the parties to the treaty who are bound by that clause and within the limits set out in the clause when uae signed the convention they put reservations on article ix both sudan and the uae are parties to the genocide convention sudan having acceded to the convention on october and the uae on november the uae when acceding to the convention formulated a reservation to article ix which reads as follows the government of the state of the united arab emirates having considered the aforementioned convention and approved the contents thereof formally declares its accession to the convention and makes a reservation with respect to article thereof concerning the submission of disputes arising between the contracting parties relating to the interpretation application or fulfilment of this convention to the international court of justice at the request of any of the parties to the dispute they concluded that those reservation helds and as sudan strongly based the raised issue on article ix the court says that it can not hold jurisdiction on the case and dismissed it the court thus considers that the uae s reservation has the effect of excluding article ix from the provisions of the genocide convention in force between the parties the court concludes from the foregoing that having regard to the uae s reservation to article ix of the genocide convention this article cannot constitute prima facie a basis for the jurisdiction of the court in the present case it follows that the court lacking prima facie jurisdiction to entertain sudan s application cannot indicate the provisional measures requested in order to protect the rights invoked in the application submitted by sudan the court further considers that in light of the reservation made by the uae to the compromissory clause contained in article ix of the genocide convention and in the absence of any other basis of jurisdiction the court manifestly lacks jurisdiction to entertain sudan s application but it notes having come to the conclusion that it manifestly lacks jurisdiction the court is precluded by its statute from taking any position on the merits of the claims made by sudan however as the court has stated on numerous previous occasions there is a fundamental distinction between the question of acceptance by the states of the court s jurisdiction and the conformity of their acts with international law whether or not states have accepted the jurisdiction of the court pursuant to article ix of the genocide convention they are required to comply with their obligations under that instrument and they remain responsible for acts attributable to them which are contrary to their international obligations source so we have an actual genocide being ignored in sudan while a war to remove an internationally recognized terrorist organization is legally entertained as a genocide and publicly touted as such']

commonly presented due to their limit of outside genes over centuries this also led to an increase in genetic disorders found disproportionately more amongst ashkenazi jews specifally race is jewish groups ashkenazi jews have been extensively studied over the last years and their origins are nearing full resolution ashkenazi jews are remarkably genetically homogeneous due to a genetic bottleneck in the middle ages ashkenazi jews are a mixture of levantine middle eastern and european ancestries it is beyond any reasonable doubt from autosomal and ydna evidence that ashkenazi jews have significant middle eastern genealogical descent and ancestry which is manifested in genetic markers which are close to lebanese syrian druze palestinian kurdish and other middle eastern groups ashkenazi jews have considerable shared ancestry with other jewish groups including sephardic and mizrachi jews which predates the jewish diaspora the most recent autosomal estimates of ashkenazi ancestry from full genome sequencing and using modern refernce populations from the near east and europe indicate they are approximately middle eastern and european some recent autosomal analyses such as xue et al indicate that ashkenazi jewish european ancestry is predominantly southern european with a smaller degree of eastern european admixture groundbreaking research still in abstract form and not released in full by shai carmi et al on ancient caananite dna sequenced from bone fragments at archaeological sites in israel which serves as a better proxy for ancient near eastern populations than modern levantine populations who were likely impacted by the arabic expansion and other admixture events indicate ashkenazi jews can trace approximately of their ancestry to the ancient near east more than of ashkenazi patrilineal ydna clades are from the near east indicating strong direct middle eastern patrilineal ancestry the maternal ancestry from mtdna clades of ashkenazi jews is debated by the scientific community and there is not a firm consensus as to whether they are predominantly from the near east as put forward by karl skorecki and doron behar or from europe as put forward by marta d costa the genetic evidence ydna mtdna and autosomal dna does not support a khazar origin for ashkenazi jews sources']

Name: 127_protonmail_google_vpn_email
Representative_Docs: ['google can be swapped for duckduckgo or ecosia plant a tree with your search microsofts replacement has always been linux and open souce software linux mint is a good start for analysis of the article you linked protonmail has an onion domain that allows users to visit their site using the tor browser protonmail even has an ssl cert for that onion address even though it s completely unnecessary when a user makes a new account with protonmail on tor they are re directed from protonmail s onion to com address this breaks your secure encrypted connection to their onion address enabling your identification there are absolutely no technical reasons for this feature in fact the only other websites that operate like this are suspected nsa cia honeypots it redirecting you to com wouldn t change anything you would still be connected to your part of the proxychain eg all the data you send would still go through hops before reaching the destination proof of this would be that the tor browser takes some time to load either onion or com websites professor nadim kobeissi mathematically proved that protonmail does not provide end to end encryption meaning protonmail has the ability to decrypt their own user s data when this was shown to be true protonmail users were outraged they had been lied to protonmail was forced to issue a public statement their statement begins like you would expect it would by shitting on the security researcher that revealed their dishonesty then they continued to say we lied to our users because other email companies did no apologies they can decrypt any of their user s data be sending them scripts that allow them to do so however they advertise that they can not protonmail s admission proves they offer the same security that gmail offers both gmail and protonmail offer encryption that they can decrypt whenever they want protonmain does have e ee issue is other email providers don t let s say i want to send an email from my protonmail account to someone who uses gmail if the email i send is encrypted they can t read it because gmail doesn t support e ee thus can t decrypt the email nor can they encrypt an email begore sending it to me this isn t an issue on proton s side it s an issue in the protocol used by emails since the protocol wasn t designed with e ee in mind i don t have time to answer to the rest
